post.description:
## Overview
Provided a valid request, this endpoint will dispatch a new real-time transaction request to our internal engine.
## Coverage Discovery Integration
If you are enrolled in Coverage Discovery at the time of the request and the submission results in non-eligible coverage, the Coverage Discovery workflow will be started automatically. In this scenario, a `"link"` response header will contain reference(s) to executed coverage discovery task(s), e.g.:
`</coverage-discovery/0716e3e8-87ee-11ee-b9d1-0242ac120002>; title="coverage discovery - Task 1"; rel="related", </coverage-discovery/0e565a58-87ee-11ee-b9d1-0242ac120002>; title="coverage discovery - Task 2"; rel="related"`
With each reference, you can retrieve more information on the status of the record via the `/coverage-discovery/{id}` endpoint.
If conditions are not met, the `link` response header will not contain any `/coverage-discovery` references.
### Callback Solution With Consolidated Real-Time Eligibility and Coverage Discovery Responses
If you are enrolled in our **callback solution** and wish to consolidate the **Real-Time Eligibility (RTE)** response with the **Coverage Discovery** response, you may opt into this capability.
When enabled, the abbreviated eligibility transaction will be included in the corresponding Coverage Discovery record.

 ⚠️ **Note:** This integrated response is **only available via callback** and **only if your organization is enrolled in this capability**.

Refer to the `/coverage-discovery/{id}` response examples for data model references.

parameters.name: x-optum-eligibility-disable-value-add
parameters.description: (Optional) A comma-delimited list of strings that disable value-added features on a request-by-request basis. If you specify a value-added feature that you are not enrolled in, it will be ignored.

get.description: Returns matching eligibility transactions. Supported query parameters: `status`, `hash`, `startDateTime`, `endDateTime` and `sort`. If no query parameters are sent in the request, all of the eligibility transactions will be returned. By adding the `status`, `hash`, `startDateTime`, and `endDateTime` parameters to the request, the transactions returned are filtered.
Returns an individual transaction with the corresponding ID, if found.

post.summary: Submit new discovery task(s) with EDI
post.description:
## Overview

__You must be enrolled in the Coverage Discovery feature in order to use this system!__

Coverage Discovery is an async process that initializes new coverage discovery paths, based on the task(s) defined on the "active" customer configuration and on the on the details of the provided `x12-270` OR the provided `x12-271`. If successful, the first response is a receipt with either a 202 status accepted for a single record or 207 if more than one record was produced from the request and the customer is configured for multiple tasks.
To test if the request meets conditions to generate tasks, see the Dry Run section. 

## Dry Run
To validate that your request meets expected conditions for the paths in which your tasks are configured, include the `dryRun = true` field in the request body. As a dry run, the request execute any discovery nor create any records; instead, the endpoint will verify your request against the configured paths in the rules engine. The response will indicate which paths met conditions and which paths failed validation. 

If successful, the first response is a receipt with either a 200 status for a single task or 207 if more than one task was produced with a status(es) of 200 in the request body. If no paths qualify, a 422 will be returned for a single task, and a 207 for multi-task with status(es) 422 in the request body (see `DryRunMultiStatusMixedResponse` example).

### Callback API
Due to the long-running nature of the discovery process, all concluded task responses will be communicated asynchronously via the provided `request.callbackUrl`.  If this is your first time using callbacks via Swagger, check out the __"Callbacks"__ tab next to __"Parameters"__.

The API specified in the `callbackUrl` that will receive the asynchronous response once discovery finishes must meet the customer-specific whitelisting requirements defined by your team. Please reach out to support if you need to configure whitelisting! This API must meet the defined callback structure in the "CustomerCallbacks" tab!

If you are unsure about the details of your request and how they might produce eligible discovery paths, you can utilize the "dryRun" field to test the request without executing any transactions! If "dryRun" is enabled, then the response will occur synchronously and ignore the callback capability described above.

204.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback

post.description:
## Overview

__You must be enrolled in the Coverage Discovery feature in order to use this system!__

Coverage Discovery is an async process that initializes new coverage discovery paths, based on the task(s) defined on the "active" customer configuration and on the on the details of the provided `canonicalEligibilityRequest` OR the provided `canonicalEligibilityResponse`. If successful, the first response is a receipt with either a 202 status accepted for a single record or 207 if more than one record was produced from the request and the customer is configured for multiple tasks.
To test if the request meets conditions to generate tasks, see the Dry Run section. 

## Dry Run
To validate that your request meets expected conditions for the paths in which your tasks are configured, include the `dryRun = true` field in the request body. As a dry run, the request execute any discovery nor create any records; instead, the endpoint will verify your request against the configured paths in the rules engine. The response will indicate which paths met conditions and which paths failed validation. 

If successful, the first response is a receipt with either a 200 status for a single task or 207 if more than one task was produced with a status(es) of 200 in the request body. If no paths qualify, a 422 will be returned for a single task, and a 207 for multi-task with status(es) 422 in the request body (see `DryRunMultiStatusMixedResponse` example).

### Callback API
Due to the long-running nature of the discovery process, all concluded task responses will be communicated asynchronously via the provided `request.callbackUrl`.  If this is your first time using callbacks via Swagger, check out the __"Callbacks"__ tab next to __"Parameters"__.

The API specified in the `callbackUrl` that will receive the asynchronous response once discovery finishes must meet the customer-specific whitelisting requirements defined by your team. Please reach out to support if you need to configure whitelisting! This API must meet the defined callback structure in the "CustomerCallbacks" tab!

If you are unsure about the details of your request and how they might produce eligible discovery paths, you can utilize the "dryRun" field to test the request without executing any transactions! If "dryRun" is enabled, then the response will occur synchronously and ignore the callback capability described above.

204.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback

get.description:
Returns matching discovery tasks. The other query parameters supported include `correlationId`, `status`, `startDateTime`, `endDateTime` and `sort`. If no query parameters are sent in the request, all of the tasks will be returned. By adding query parameters to the request, the returned records are filtered.
For example, when providing a `correlationId`, if no matching records are found where the correlationId matches the provided value, no records will be returned.
Returns an individual discovery response with the corresponding ID, if found.

get.summary: Validate the status of the system
get.description: A healthcheck of the Enhanced Eligibility workflow

oAuth.description: This API uses OAuth 2 with the client_credentials grant flow. [More info](https://api.example.com/docs/auth)

scopes.create_coveragediscovery: submit a new coverage discovery task
scopes.read_healthcheck: check the status of the system

header-tenant-id.name: x-optum-tenant-id
header-tenant-id.description: The unique ID of the tenant that invoking user belongs to. Used to enforce data tenancy.

header-correlation-id.name: x-optum-correlation-id
header-correlation-id.description: (Optional) A unique identifier value that is attached to the response that allow reference to the original request. Differs from `x-optum-trace-id` as the correlation-id is stored within the datastore for future queryability.

header-trace-id.name: x-optum-trace-id
header-trace-id.description: (Optional) A unique identifier value that is attached to the response that allow reference to the original request

schema.description: (Optional) When provided, only discovery tasks with the specified status will be returned. Valid values are 'success', 'failure', and 'pending'.

query-status.name: status
query-status.description: (Optional) The status of the eligibility transaction (e.g. 'eligible', 'ineligible').

query-start-date-time.name: startDateTime
query-start-date-time.description: (Optional) The start date for the report. Start date must be before the end date

query-end-date-time.name: endDateTime
query-end-date-time.description: (Optional) The end date for the report. Must occur after the provided start date

query-hash.name: hash
query-hash.description: (Optional) A generated value for determining the uniqueness of a transaction. This value is a hashed concatenation of demographic data on the transaction

query-sort-txns.name: sort
query-sort-txns.description: (Optional) The property to order the results of the report by. Defaults to '-processedDate', negative sign is 'desc'

query-sort-discovery.name: sort
query-sort-discovery.description: (Optional) The property to order the results of the report by. Defaults to '-startDateTime', negative sign is 'desc'

query-offset.name: offset
query-offset.description: (Optional) Pagination. The offset number to retrieve, which is determined by the limit. For example,if limit is 30 and offset is 0, then the response data will include records 1~30; If offset is 30 and limit is 30 then the response data will include records 30~59.

query-limit.name: limit
query-limit.description: (Optional) Number of transactions to return per page. Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 100. Defaults to 30.

query-return-total-count.name: returnTotalCount
query-return-total-count.description: (Optional) Whether or not to return the total number of records matching the supplied query parameters under the x-total-number HTTP response header. Defaults to false

query-correlationid.name: correlationId
query-correlationid.description: (Optional) The correlationId associated with the original request.

path-txn-id.name: id
path-txn-id.description: The unique ID of the target transaction

path-discovery-task-id.name: id
path-discovery-task-id.description: The unique ID of the target discovery task

tenantid.description: The unique ID of the tenant that invoking user belongs to. Used to enforce data tenancy.

correlationid.description: A unique identifier value that is attached to the response that allow reference to the original request. Differs from `x-optum-trace-id` as the correlation-id is stored within the datastore for future queryability.

link.description: Link to next set of pagination data

schema.example: </coverage-discovery/0716e3e8-87ee-11ee-b9d1-0242ac120002>; title="coverage discovery - Default Discovery Task"; rel="related", </coverage-discovery/0e565a58-87ee-11ee-b9d1-0242ac120002>; title="coverage discovery - Chained Discovery Task"; rel="related"

rte-link.description: (Optional) The unique path(s) for spawned Coverage Discovery task(s) if you are enrolled in Coverage Discovery and a job was initiated on your behalf during the execution of your transaction. You can use this path to look up more information about the task. If you're enrolled in Coverage Discovery and this response header is absent on a transaction, no Coverage Discovery task was initiated.

traceid.description: A unique identifier value that is attached to the response that allow reference to the original request.

total-count.description: The total number of records associated with the query. For example, with the query `?correlationId=123456579`, `x-total-count` returns the total amount of records associated with the given correlationId.

allOf.description: (Conditionally-Required) A valid Canonical Eligibility request. Required if `canonicalEligibilityResponse` is omitted.

canonicalizerVersion.description: version of the clearinghouse to canonical mapper

clearinghouseRequest.description: A stringified version of the JSON request sent to the clearinghouse

clearinghouseResponse.description: A stringified version of the JSON response received from the clearinghouse

customerRequest.description: A stringified version of the JSON request sent by the customer

x12-270.description: The received 270 message for the transaction

metadata.description: Data captured during the processing of an Eligibility Transaction.

allOf.description: (Conditionally-Required) The canonical transaction response that was previously processed by the RCMC Eligibility engine. Required if `canonicalEligibilityRequest` is omitted.

callbackUrl.description: (Optional) The URL of the consumer-owned API that will receive an asynchronous response once discovery finishes. The URL must meet the customer-specific whitelisting requirements defined by your team. Please reach out to support if you need to configure whitelisting! This API must meet the defined callback structure in the "CustomerCallbacks" tab!

dryRun.description: When set to true, no discovery paths will be initialized, but instead will evaluate the request and respond with the discovery paths that are configured and meet validation requirements. Use this as a tool to test the request input.

callbackUrl.description: (Optional) The URL of the consumer-owned API that will receive an asynchronous response once discovery finishes. The URL must meet the customer-specific whitelisting requirements defined by your team. Please reach out to support if you need to configure whitelisting! This API must meet the defined callback structure in the "CustomerCallbacks" tab!

dryRun.description: When set to true, no discovery paths will be initialized, but instead will evaluate the request and respond with the discovery paths that are configured and meet validation requirements. Use this as a tool to test the request input.

example: Unprocessable Entity - Unable to deserialize record

Unprocessable Resource - Task chained discover task: No discovery paths qualified for execution. Please use the dryRun field to validate your input produces the expected paths prior to submitting the next request.

id.description: Unique identifier of the newly created task record.

name.description: Customer-appointed name that ascribes meaning and/or business need for task. Defined during enrollment. If no name is provided by customer, the Product team will provide a default value.

schema.description: List of coverage discovery task records spawned by transaction.

items.description: A coverage discovery task record spawned by a transaction.

status.description: HTTP status code returned for coverage discovery task.

id.description: Unique identifier of newly created task record.

name.description: Customer-appointed name that ascribes meaning and/or business need for task. Defined during enrollment. If no name is provided by customer, the Product team will provide a default value.

href.description: path link that includes the unique identifier of the newly created task. Value can be appended to the base url to retrieve the record by id.

Error.description: The base object model for errors returned from the workflow

controlNumber.description: Segment: ISA, Element: ISA13, Notes: Required, Interchange Control Number - must be exactly 9 positive unsigned numeric characters.

tradingPartnerServiceId.description: Loop: 2100A Segment: NM1, Element: NM109, Notes: we send this as MN108 as PI

tradingPartnerName.description: Loop: 2100A, Segment: NM1, Element: NM103, Notes: organizational name

organizationName.description: Loop: 2100B Segment: MN1, Element: NM103, Notes: NM101=PR when providerType='payer' && payerId is present otherwise 1P for Provider, NM102=2 Non-Person Entity, organizationName 1-60 alphanumeric characters

firstName.description: Loop: 2100B Segment: MN1, Element: NM104, Notes: NM101=PR when providerType='payer' && payerId is present otherwise 1P for Provider, NM102=1 Person, firstName 1-35 alphanumeric characters

lastName.description: Loop: 2100B Segment: MN1, Element: NM103, Notes: NM101=PR when providerType='payer' && payerId is present otherwise 1P for Provider, NM102=1 Person, lastName 1-60 alphanumeric characters

npi.description: Loop: 2100B Segment: MN1, Element: NM109, Notes: NM108=XX Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services National Provider Identifier 2-80 alphanumeric characters

serviceProviderNumber.description: Loop: 2100B Segment: MN1, Element: NM109, Notes: NM108=SV Service Provider Number 2-80 alphanumeric characters

payorId.description: Loop: 2100B Segment: MN1, Element: NM109, Notes: NM101=PR when providerType='payer' && payerId is present otherwise 1P for Provider, NM108=PI Payor Identification 2-80 alphanumeric characters

taxId.description: Loop: 2100B Segment: MN1, Element: NM109, Notes: NM108=FI Federal Taxpayer's Identification Number 2-80 alphanumeric characters

ssn.description: Loop: 2100B, Segment: NM1, Element: NM109 Notes: NM108=34 Social Security Number

providerCode.description: Loop: 2100B Segment: PRV, Element: PRV01, Notes: PRV02=PXC Allowed descriptions are: 'AD' Admitting, 'AT' Attending, 'BI' Billing, 'CO' Consulting, 'CV' Covering, 'H' Hospital, 'HH' Home Health Care, 'LA' Laboratory, 'OT' Other Physician, 'P1' Pharmacist, 'P2' Pharmacy, 'PC' Primary Care Physician, 'PE' Performing, 'R' Rural Health Clinic, 'RF' Referring, 'SB' Submitting, 'SK' Skilled Nursing Facility, 'SU' Supervising

Loop: 2110C and 2110D, Notes: Eligibility or Benefit Information, EQ02 and beyond only

encounter.description: Loop: 2110C and 2110D, Notes: Eligibility or Benefit Information

allOf.description: A json representation of a standard eligibility 270 request. See this [link](https://developer.optum.com/eligibilityandclaims/reference/medicaleligibility) for more information.

Transaction.description: The base object model for the `/transactions` endpoints and the canonical model for Enhanced Eligibility

id.description: The unique ID of the transaction

sourceId.description: The id of the transaction that spawned this record. If empty, this transaction has no parent.

correlationId.description: An ID provided by the consumer at the time of transaction processing

processedDate.description: The time the transaction was processed by the system

description.description: A human readable representation of the 'value' field.

errors.description: A list of errors that occurred during process

x12-271.description: The sent 271 message for the transaction

service.description: Text description of service type code

networkClass.description: Whether the benefit conditions apply to 'in' or 'out' of network

benefitType.description: Benefit type maps to either individual or family

scope.description: Benefit field relates either to a service type or is common (not related to a service type)

insuranceType.description: Insurance classification: Medicare, Medicaid, or AllPayers

benefitQualifier.example: DY (value of the benefit is in days)
benefitQualifier.description: Benefit field code identifying type or source

benefits.description: Detailed benefit information for each service returned by the payer

eligibilityCategory.description: Expresses the eligibility category of the member to properly administer health benefits and coverage (from Department of Defense)

patient.description: The patient details captured on the eligibility response

payer.description: Represents data about the payer that is on record for the eligibility request

plan.description: Detailed information about the Subscriber’s plan, group, and policy

otherCoverage.example: FIRST HEALTH LIFE & HEALTH INSURANCE COMPANY

case.description: Used to clarify plan level details

type.description: Reference Information as defined for a Reference Identification Qualifier

number.description: Group or policy number associated with the plan mapping to the policy reference identifier from the payer

preferredProviderOrg.description: Details about the preferred provider organization

subscriber.description: Subscriber data that originated from the Payer

CoverageDiscoveryTask.description: The base object model for the `/coverage-discovery` endpoints

id.description: The unique ID of the task

status.description: The current state of the discovery task

name.description: Customer-appointed name that ascribes meaning and/or business need for task. Defined during enrollment. If no name is provided by customer, the Product team will provide a default value.

startDateTime.description: The time that the discovery task was initiated

endDatetime.description: The time the discovery task finished

realTime.description: The abbreviated parent Real Time transaction response that triggered the Coverage Discovery workflow. This object will be populated when a Customer enrolls in Integrated Coverage Discovery and selects the `Include RealTime Response` capability to consolidate responses.

timestamp.description: The date-time the parent transaction was executed

id.description: The unique ID of the parent transaction response from the Real Time Flow.

status.description: The coverage outcome of the transaction (eligible, ineligible, etc.)

chcPayerId.description: The CHC PayerID used in the submission of the transaction

x12-271.description: The x12-271 response from the submitted transaction

transaction.description: A list of successful discovery paths. A path is deemed "successful" if the transaction produced has "eligible" coverage.

discoveryPaths.description: A list of routes that are automatically generated based on customer configuration and supplied input data to attempt to find positive patient coverage.

name.description: The name of the discovery path

description.description: A brief description of the path

timestamp.description: The date-time the path was executed

id.description: The unique ID of the transaction

status.description: The coverage outcome of the transaction (eligible, ineligible, etc.)

chcPayerId.description: The CHC PayerID used in the submission of the transaction

x12-271.description: The x12-271 response from the submitted transaction

successful.description: A list of successful discovery paths. A path is deemed "successful" if the transaction produced has "eligible" coverage.

name.description: The name of the discovery path

description.description: A brief description of the path

timestamp.description: The date-time the path was executed

id.description: The unique ID of the transaction

status.description: The coverage outcome of the transaction (eligible, ineligible, etc.)

chcPayerId.description: The CHC PayerID used in the submission of the transaction

x12-271.description: The x12-271 response from the submitted transaction

unsuccessful.description: A list of unsuccessful discovery paths. A path is deemed "unsuccessful" if the transaction produced has any errors or "ineligible" coverage.

name.description: The name of the discovery path

description.description: A brief description of the path

timestamp.description: The date-time the path was executed

transaction.description: An empty object, as coverage discovery is pending

pending.description: A list of discovery paths that have yet to be executed.

name.description: The name of the discovery path

description.description: A brief description of the path

timestamp.description: The date-time the path was executed

reason.description: The reason why the path was skipped

skipped.description: A list of skipped discovery paths. A path is considered "skipped" if there was an error building the path's requests OR if another path resulted in found coverage before the "skipped" path was executed, resulting in early termination.

value.body: Unprocessable Resource - Task chained discover task: No discovery paths qualified for execution. Please use the dryRun field to validate your input produces the expected paths prior to submitting the next request.

skipped.name: Commercial
skipped.reason: request does not meet path conditions

skipped.name: HMO
skipped.reason: request does not meet path conditions

skipped.name: Commercial
skipped.reason: request does not meet path conditions

skipped.name: HMO
skipped.reason: request does not meet path conditions
